cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to cross south Florida overnight, emerge into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Saturday, then turn northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida near the Miami–Fort Lauderdale area

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Florida tonight–Saturday; northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama Sunday–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤34-kt probability only 7%)
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible late weekend as moisture spreads northward
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along southeast Georgia coast
